news_header: M23 rebels are advancing towards Goma in the DRC, capturing key cities and worsening the security situation, while the US proposes a transport corridor to stabilize the region.
news_text: The M23 rebels are making significant territorial gains in North Kivu Province of the DRC, recently capturing Minova, a crucial supply route to Goma. This has led to a humanitarian crisis and increased clashes, displacing thousands. The Congolese government accuses Rwanda of supporting M23, which Rwanda denies. The US has suggested developing the Lobito Corridor to facilitate mineral transport from the DRC and Zambia to Angola, but this proposal has not been well received by Rwanda. Analysts believe the proposal is unlikely to succeed, especially with the changing political landscape in the US.
